story.intro:
During a long road trip to visit your parents all the way in Manitoba, your car suddenly broke down in a remote area, with no cellphone service nor anyone nearby.
You venture into a nearby forest searching for help. There you discover a spooky mansion & decide to enter in desperation, only to be immediately surrounded by zombies.
In a state of panic you run into the attic for safety.
Now, after catching your breath & realizing the horrific situation you've found yourself in, you must navigate through the rooms,
defeat the zombies & find your way out!
story.gameEnd:
The latch works, & the door unlocks. You shove the door open & run out the house, using your flashlight to navigate through the midnight darkness of the woods. Sprinting back to your broken-down car by the highway,
 relief washes over you as you find police investigating the scene. You've been awake, alert & tired for so long & are too exhausted to explain the truth of what you experienced.
The police assist with your car & ensure your safety, casually dismissing your condition after they found amounts of strong psychedelics in your car.
They don't bother conversating with you much, to which you don't mind. The next morning, clean & composed, you resume your drive to your parents' house, attempting to leave the nightmarish ordeal behind.
However, the trauma lingers, etching a lasting mark on your psyche.

*********THE END**********

game_over.message:
You have succumbed to your injuries. Remember, managing your health against zombies is crucial.
Try to avoid unnecessary fights & consider smarter weapon choices.

You took too long to get out, & the toxic air finally overtook you. The lethal air within the forsaken walls
of this zombie-infested house have claimed another victim, a fresh new zombie to inhabit its walls forever. As time slipped away, the poisonous atmosphere took its toll, sealing your fate.
Game over. Remember: Time management is key; plan your moves carefully & keep an eye out for clues & shortcuts.

rooms.name: attic
rooms.first_text:
You are in the pitch-black attic, the only way out is down, the way you came.
You sense a fuse box, its outline faintly visible but powerless. You notice something small, smooth, & round on the floor beside the fuse box, resembling batteries,
as well as what appears to be an axe. You realize the smart thing to do is to probably take both of them.
rooms.notallowed: It's too dark and dangerous to go down right now. Make sure you power on the fuse box and take the axe first for protection.
rooms.after_text: You are back in the attic. Looks cozy & safe, nice spot to catch your breath. You can continue your quest downstairs.

rooms.name: hallway
rooms.first_text:
You've made it down to the hallway, once step closer to escaping this place. You find here two zombies blocking half open doors to your east and west.
The only way into those rooms will require you to kill both of them. Beside you, you see a bookshelf, empty except for a scribe with words & what appears to a lockpick.
The air quality is harsh & choking you, making you almost nauseous, & you realize you need to escape the house quickly before you slowly pass out & die.
You sense that there is the presence of another entity nearby in this house that isn't a zombie.
rooms.after_text: You are in the hallway. Can go up, east or west to attic, office & bedroom respectively.
rooms.WestorEastwithzombies: The zombie is in the way! You'll have to kill the zombie first to go this way.

rooms.name: bedroom
rooms.first_text:
You open the door to find an old bedroom, filled with cobwebs & a thin layer of dust across the floor & furniture. Theres a menacing zombie standing
& groaning on the bed; no one has slept in this bed in a while, & you doubt you would want to lay down on it either.
The windows are too small for you to fit through, & too high up to jump out of. Nothing in this room looks interesting,
except a bathroom to the north, as well as a locked rotary combination safe. What could be the passcode, & what could be inside?
rooms.after_text: You are in the bedroom. There's a safe, northern path to bathroom, & an eastern exit to hallway.

rooms.name: bathroom
rooms.first_text:
You find yourself in a run-down bathroom. The sink is stained, & a cracked mirror shows your worried face. At least there's no zombies here,
but there are cockroaches & bugs. There is a curtain covering the tub but it's too disgusting to check out unless you have a good reason to. Yuck! The only way out is south, the way you came.
rooms.after_text: You are in the filthy bathroom again, which has a dirty curtain covering something. Only way out is back south to bedroom.

rooms.name: office
rooms.first_text:
Looks like a super old fashioned office room. There's a locked door to go down to the first floor from here, but you'll
need to find a key & lockpicks won't work. There's two more dangerous zombies in your way of getting to that door. The desk shelves are all open & empty,
but one catches your eye;this shelf has a shiny handle, but it's loosely locked; can you open it with your lockpicks?
rooms.after_text: You are in the messy office room. There's a shelf, door leading downstairs, & western path to hallway.
rooms.notallowed: The door to go downstairs is locked; try finding and using the key first.

rooms.name: living room
rooms.first_text:
You made it downstairs to the living room! It's old fashioned with an old box TV & scattered DVD cassettes. Here's there's two more zombies in your of getting
to the western foyer. There's nothing here, except a full bookshelf with an empty slot asking for 'Victor's Diary' to be placed on it to unlock passage to go down the basement.
rooms.after_text: You are in the living room. Can go upstairs from here, and west to foyer, as well as down to basement if you have the diary to use on bookshelf.
rooms.downwithoutdiary: The passage to the basement is locked. Find a diary and use it here to unlock it.
rooms.unlockedbasementbutnoflashlight: It's too dark and dangerous to go down, who knows what's lurking down there! Get a source of light first.

rooms.name: kitchen
rooms.first_text:
You enter the dirty kitchen. There's 2 zombies here, and a south exit to the garage, as well as a locked cupboard containing useful items.
Continue your search for the latch!
rooms.after_text: You are back in the kitchen, ready to cook & eat rotten zombies? Just kidding. Can go south or east from here.

rooms.name: garage
rooms.first_text:
You enter the garage, an ugly dead end. Only thing here is a broken car like yours outside, & a zombie guarding an open box which contains what seems to be a diary.
Try to retrieve the diary from the box!
rooms.after_text:
You are back in the garage, only way back is north back to kitchen. smelling like grease, to cheer you up, at least your broken car outside is cooler than the one here.
The box in the corner contained a diary.

rooms.name: foyer
rooms.first_text:
You made it to the main foyer, it's very big & fancy, & there's 3 zombies here. There's a western exit to the kitchen, & the front door is heavily locked,
requiring you to find a latch to open it & exit as lockpicks won't work on it. Continue searching, maybe it's in the basement!
rooms.after_text: You are in the foyer, where your locked northern escape is. Find the latch & use it to get outta here! You can go east & west from here, and north if you find and use the latch.
rooms.notallowed: North from the foyer is the exit, but it's locked; you need to find the latch to unlock it.

rooms.name: basement
rooms.first_text:
You finally descend into the basement where you see in the far end 3 zombies guarding the latch you're looking for to unlock the front door. There's no exits here neither anything interesting,
besides the latch. Kill the zombies to get the latch and your freedom!
rooms.after_text: You are back in the basement. Nothing to see here besides horrific remains of human skeletons & dead zombies. Kill the zombies to take the latch, if you haven't.

subrooms.name: shelf
subrooms.locked_message: Looks like you'll need lockpicks to open this.
subrooms.unlocked_message: It opened! Inside you find a piece of paper with some numbers on it!

subrooms.name: safe
subrooms.locked_message: This safe can't be unlocked by force nor by lockpicks as it has a rotary combination lock. Where can you find the code?
subrooms.unlocked_message: The code from the paper worked! Inside you find a gun, no way!

subrooms.name: curtain
subrooms.locked_message: Not trying to look in there, it's too disgusting!
subrooms.unlocked_message: Despite the sheer disgust, you pull back the curtain and look into the bathtub and find a key on the floor!

subrooms.name: box
subrooms.unlocked_message: You open the box. A lone diary rests in here, could it be Victor's Diary?

subrooms.name: cupboard
subrooms.locked_message: You'll need to use the lockpicks upstairs to unlock this.
subrooms.unlocked_message: The lockpicks worked on the cupboard, and in it you find a flashlight and a journal! Both of these look promising.

items.name: batteries
items.desc: Used to power on fuse box to power the house.
items.TakenText: These batteries look like they could work on the fuse box to give light to the house! Try them on the fuse box.
items.UseText: The batteries powered on the fuse box! You restore all power to the house, except for the basement which isn't working.

items.name: axe
items.TakenText: This will be really helpful to fight off all the zombies downstairs. Maybe there's more weapons in the house?
items.UseText: This is weapon, I can attack with it instead.

items.name: scribe
items.desc: Riddle containing a clue pointing to something in a dirty tub.
items.TakenText: Cool scribe, it has something written on it.
items.UseText: The scribe is hinting to something in a dirty tub. Wonder what it means.
items.ReadText:
This scrap of paper has a little riddle written on it in cursive handwriting. It reads:
'I'm not a lock, but a tool that turns,
In the bathroom, where cleanliness yearns.
Near the basin or tub, where water flows free,
Search for me there, & the key you shall see.'

items.name: lockpick
items.desc: Useful tool needed to unlock various things.
items.TakenText: A handy lockpick set! Back in high school you had a set just like this & were a pro at lockpicking. This can definitely unlock some cool things throughout this house.
items.UseText: Try opening locked things while having this lockpick.

items.name: flashlight
items.desc: Required to navigate the dark basement.
items.TakenText: You grab the flashlight & it works! You can use this to access the dark mysterious basement where there's no light.
items.UseText: Seems this was turned on the second I grabbed it.

items.name: gun
items.desc: An old handgun, this could do serious damage.
items.TakenText: This gun looks like it was made 100 years ago. Nonetheless, it will make it easier to kill zombies, but you notice it only has 15 bullets left, so use wisely.
items.UseText: Wield this weapon and attack zombies with it.

items.name: paper
items.TakenText: Seems like a 5 digit numerical code for a safe. Wonder where the safe is, & what could lie inside of it?
items.UseText: You can't 'use' this paper. Try reading it instead.
items.ReadText: 'Safe Code: 73582', but in what order is the code entered?

items.name: key
items.TakenText: What was this key doing in this nasty bathtub? Nonetheless, let's go to the office & use it to unlock the key to downstairs.
items.UseText: This key unlocked the door leading to downstairs! Let's go down and get closer to getting out of here.
items.Wrong_Text: No need to use this key here.

items.name: latch
items.desc: Unlock the front door for escape.
items.TakenText: Taken! Finally, let's use this latch to escape the house from the foyer.
items.UseText:
You use the latch on the door to enable it to be opened. After struggling for a few seconds, it worked; the front door exit out of the house has been unlocked!
Exit north from here, the foyer, to get out of this nightmare once and for all!
items.Wrong_Text: Try using this in the foyer on the front door. It might unlock the door to get out of this place.

items.name: journal
items.TakenText: A small journal! It seems handmade in a rush, with a hard leather cover & only two pages inside, held together with strings. What could it contain? Read it to find out. Time is running out!
items.UseText: There doesn't seem to ba any use of this journal besides reading what it might have inside of it.
items.ReadText:
The small yet concise journal reads:
	Dear my beloved Seraphina,
		It is I, your dear husband of 30 years, Victor Blackthorne. I am grieved of your passing & want to raise you from the dead so that we may live together once again. I am locking
 this journal away in the kitchen & hope you will find it, as you always found me in my lows & helped me. I am composing this final letter in case you come back but I am longer here.
 My quest for forbidden knowledge has found me digging up the dead from the cemetery & experimenting on them in our basement, in hopes to be able to raise you too, my love.
But the undead are overpowering me & not listening to my commands & I fear my death is certain, & I will never be able to see you again nor be buried with you.
If you ever do come back, my diary in the garage written in our secret language has instructions on this forbidden disgraced knowledge so that you may bring me back too.
I have hidden a gun in our safe with the the combination code 58273, & have locked all doors & windows to prevent the zombies from escaping outside, as well as powered off the house.
 Place my diary on the bookshelf in the living room to come find me, as I will spend my final moments hiding in the basement before the zombies get to me.
I have with me the latch, the only way to unlock the front door to get out this nightmare.
Retrieve it from the basement, unlock the front door, & release these malevolent beings once & for all. The world must bear the consequences of my anguish & suffering
 in my innocent pursuit of tranquility & repose to have my wife back. Our suffering is ceaseless & harrowing, & I harbor no hopes for a better world for anyone except for us both.

items.name: diary
items.TakenText: You take a well maintained black hardcover diary with just two eerie words on its cover, reading 'Victor's Diary'. Looking inside, it's words look all gibberish though.
items.UseText: Using the diary on shelf causes the bookshelf to slide down & reveal the stairs to basement, where you're potential escape awaits! It's too dark down there, & you'll need a source of light to go.
items.ReadText:
Zerfle gorphbix xentwylph quazzr, flibjik phwizzt kludgymo! Snixqwert flobbernoodle shnazzzle, bixbop fwoo!
Jorplixx grimblyquak, zizzle zork. Wibblyquib glippophop, yipzop!
Twirlygig blizzblazz, xanthar squopple!Fizzwizzle snazzlefrizz, quibberquak!
items.Wrong_Text: No need to use this diary here. The only use you have for it would be to try using it on the living room bookshelf.

axe.name: axe
axe.kill_message: Lucky, your axe killed the zombie
axe.kill_damage: Zombie health -= 20 to 35 damage (If it kills)
